discussion.content:
A and C are correct!., A is correct because when a PDB04 is created a new service in registed with this name and asigned at CDB level for visibility.

E is not correct because the service creation is reflected on CDB, when you perform a lsncrctl services can check this.

choices.C: A database managed by Oracle Restart can have additional services created or existing services modified by using the srvctl utility for each PDB.
choices.D: Only a common user can create additional services for a PDB.
choices.A: When a PDB is created, a service is automatically started in the instance with the same name as the PDB.
choices.E: When a PDB is created, a service with the same name as the PDB is created in the PDB.
choices.B: The default service that is automatically created by a database at the time of PDB creation can be dropped, provided a new additional service is created.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about service creation for pluggable databases (PDBs)?

discussion.content:
B is correct!,
because of 12c can use IMPORT CATALOG RMAN command, and this feature is for catalog moving operations, you do not need issue expdp and impdp like previous and older versions.
https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/BRADV/rcmcatdb.htm#GUID-12C01FD0-2CFF-478E-B80C-FF7639EF2F4C

questions.question_text:
You want to move your existing recovery catalog to another database.
Examine the steps:
1)Export the catalog data by using the Data Pump Export utility in the source database.
2) Create a recovery catalog user and grant the necessary privileges in the target database.
3) Create a recovery catalog by using the create catalog command.
4)Import the catalog data into the new recovery catalog by using the Data Pump Import utility in the target database.
5)Import the source recovery catalog schema by using the import catalog command.
6)Connect to the destination database.
7) Connect as catalog to the destination recovery catalog schema.
Identify the option with the correct sequence for moving the recovery catalog.

choices.B: It automatically flashes back all the indexes on the employes table.
choices.C: It automatically flashes back any triggers defined on the table.
choices.D: It flashes back only the structure of the table and not the data.
choices.A: It flashes back the employee table and all the constraints associated with the table.
choices.E: It flashes back the data from the recycle bin and the existing data in the original table is permanently lost.

questions.question_text:
Your database supports an OLTP workload. Examine the output of the query:
SQL> SSLECT target_mttr, estimated_mttr

FROM v$instance_recovery -

Target_mttrestimated_mttr -
---------------------- ---------------------------
To ensure faster instance recovery, you set the fast_start_mttrjtargh:t initialization parameter to
30.
What is the effect of this setting on the database?

choices.B: The frequency of log switches is increased.
choices.C: The overhead on database performance is increased because of frequent writes to disk.

choices.A: The movement of all segments to a target tablespace with a higher degree of compression, on a different storage tier, when the source tablespace exceeds tbs percent used
choices.B: Setting the target tablespace to read-only after the segments are moved
choices.C: The movement of some segments to a target tablespace with a higher degree of compression, on a different storage tier, when the source tablespace exceeds T3S percent used
choices.D: Taking the target tablespace offline after the segments are moved
choices.E: The movement of some blocks to a target tablespace with a lower degree of compression, on a different storage tier, when the source tablespace exceeds tbs

questions.question_text:
In your database, the tbs percent used parameter is set to 60 and the tbs percent free parameter is set to 20.
Which two storage-tiering actions might be automated when using Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) to automate data movement?
